definition: can/may/able to/to approve/to permit/to suit/(particle used for emphasis) certainly/very
variant of 挽[wan3]/to draw (a cart)/to lament the dead
to pull/to draw (a cart or a bow)/to roll up/to coil/to carry on the arm/to lament the dead/(fig.) to pull against/to recover
to circle/to go back/to turn around/to answer/to return/to revolve/Hui ethnic group (Chinese Muslims)/time/classifier for acts of a play/section or chapter (of a classic book)

sentences.english: If you leave it too late, there may be nothing left to save.
sentences.chinese: 假如你行动得太晚，局面或许就将无可挽回。

sentences.english: That's what he's leaving had been like, sudden and with an awful finality.
sentences.chinese: 他的离去也是一样，突如其来，并且无可挽回。

sentences.english: That''s what Mike''s leaving had been like, sudden and with an awful finality.
sentences.chinese: 迈克的离去也是一样，突如其来，并且无可挽回。
他的皮肤无可挽回地布满了皱纹。

definition: spilt water is difficult to retrieve (idiom)/it's no use crying over spilt milk/what's done is done and can't be reversed/the damage is done/once divorced, there's no reuniting
too late for regrets (idiom); It is useless to repent after the event.
to repeat errors/to continue blundering/to make continuous mistakes
unable to turn around a hopeless situation (idiom)/to fail to save the situation
unable to turn around a hopeless situation (idiom)/to fail to save the situation
lit. the path exhausted, the end of the road (idiom); an impasse/in a plight with no way out/things have reached a dead end
consigned to eternal damnation/with no hope of reprieve
